pr_title: Form Recognizer service method parameter guideline update

timeline.body: Will move this to a common function.
timeline.bodyText: Will move this to a common function.
timeline.bodyHTML: Will move this to a common function.
timeline.author: samvaity

timeline.body:
Still debating if I should keep this API, as I think this parameter set would be more commonly used. And want to keep it simple for the users to pass in `FormContentType` without having to create options even if it isn't necessarily required.

@srnagar  thoughts?
timeline.bodyText:
Still debating if I should keep this API, as I think this parameter set would be more commonly used. And want to keep it simple for the users to pass in FormContentType without having to create options even if it isn't necessarily required.
@srnagar  thoughts?
timeline.bodyHTML:
Still debating if I should keep this API, as I think this parameter set would be more commonly used. And want to keep it simple for the users to pass in FormContentType without having to create options even if it isn't necessarily required.

@srnagar thoughts?
timeline.author: samvaity

replies.bodyText: If user studies show that this is a more commonly used parameter set, then I think having this method will make it easier for the majority of the users compared to creating options.
replies.author: srnagar

timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
static final Duration DEFAULT_DURATION = Duration.ofSeconds(5);
static final Duration DEFAULT_POLL_INTERVAL = Duration.ofSeconds(5);
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.body: This should be set to `DEFAULT_DURATION` in case the setter is not called.
timeline.bodyText: This should be set to DEFAULT_DURATION in case the setter is not called.
timeline.bodyHTML: This should be set to DEFAULT_DURATION in case the setter is not called.
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.body:
Should this be named `BeginRecognizeReceiptsOptions` as per [guidelines](https://azure.github.io/azure-sdk/java_design.html#service-method-parameters)?

>DO name the options type after the name of the service method it is used for, such that the type is named <operation>Options. For example, above the method was createBlob, and so the options type was named CreateBlobOptions
timeline.bodyText:
Should this be named BeginRecognizeReceiptsOptions as per guidelines?

DO name the options type after the name of the service method it is used for, such that the type is named Options. For example, above the method was createBlob, and so the options type was named CreateBlobOptions
timeline.bodyHTML:
Should this be named BeginRecognizeReceiptsOptions as per guidelines?

DO name the options type after the name of the service method it is used for, such that the type is named Options. For example, above the method was createBlob, and so the options type was named CreateBlobOptions
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText:
I think this could serve as an exception since RecognizeOPtions is not confined to just receipts API. It can be applied to the receipt and content API.
I remember discussing this with @JonathanGiles that some options could be more generic in nature and could be applied to more than one method. So, in that case, we cannot follow the <operation-name>Options naming.
replies.author: samvaity

timeline.body: Do we need this method? It's the same as [beginRecognizeContent(RecognizeOptions recognizeOptions)](https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/pull/12111/files#diff-f3e13c2bd95cecb8a90329a3c1e1f6dbR297) below.
timeline.bodyText: Do we need this method? It's the same as beginRecognizeContent(RecognizeOptions recognizeOptions) below.
timeline.bodyHTML: Do we need this method? It's the same as beginRecognizeContent(RecognizeOptions recognizeOptions) below.
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText:
I think we should have  beginRecognizeContentFromUrl(RecognizeOptions recognizeOptions)
too, since it allows the user an option to pass the configurable options when passing in a URL input for the form/receipt.
replies.author: samvaity

replies.bodyText: Updated to remove the suggested overload as it can be accessed via  beginRecognizeContent(RecognizeOptions recognizeOptions)
replies.author: samvaity

timeline.body: This method can be removed now as there is [beginRecognizeCustomForms(RecognizeCustomFormsOptions recognizeCustomFormsOptions)](https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/pull/12111/files#diff-f3e13c2bd95cecb8a90329a3c1e1f6dbR181).
timeline.bodyText: This method can be removed now as there is beginRecognizeCustomForms(RecognizeCustomFormsOptions recognizeCustomFormsOptions).
timeline.bodyHTML: This method can be removed now as there is beginRecognizeCustomForms(RecognizeCustomFormsOptions recognizeCustomFormsOptions).
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.message: Update to remove extra overload, fix checkstyle:
Update to remove extra overload, fix checkstyle:

timeline.body: nit: It's a little confusing that RecognizeCustomFormsOptions takes arguments in the order (form, length, modelId), while this function takes it in (form, modelId, length)
timeline.bodyText: nit: It's a little confusing that RecognizeCustomFormsOptions takes arguments in the order (form, length, modelId), while this function takes it in (form, modelId, length)
timeline.bodyHTML: nit: It's a little confusing that RecognizeCustomFormsOptions takes arguments in the order (form, length, modelId), while this function takes it in (form, modelId, length)
timeline.author: iscai-msft

replies.bodyText: I think (form, length, modelId) could be the correct ordering. I will update to follow that ordering and get consistent, thanks!
replies.author: samvaity

timeline.body: Remove the annotation too as this now a package-private method.
timeline.bodyText: Remove the annotation too as this now a package-private method.
timeline.bodyHTML: Remove the annotation too as this now a package-private method.
timeline.author: srnagar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -94,41 +96,20 @@ @ServiceMethod(returns = ReturnType.COLLECTION) public PollerFlux> beginRecognizeCustomFormsFromUrl(String formUrl, String modelId) { - return beginRecognizeCustomFormsFromUrl(formUrl, modelId, false, null); + return beginRecognizeCustomFormsFromUrl(new RecognizeCustomFormsOptions(formUrl, modelId)); } - /** - * Recognizes form data from documents using optical character recognition (OCR) and a custom trained - * model. - *

The service does not support cancellation of the long running operation and returns with an - * error message indicating absence of cancellation support.

- * - *

Code sample

- * {@codesnippet com.azure.ai.formrecognizer.FormRecognizerAsyncClient.beginRecognizeCustomFormsFromUrl#string-string-boolean-Duration} - * - * @param formUrl The source URL to the input form. - * @param modelId The UUID string format custom trained model Id to be used. - * @param includeTextDetails Include text lines and element references in the result. - * @param pollInterval Duration between each poll for the operation status. If none is specified, a default of - * 5 seconds is used. - * - * @return A {@link PollerFlux} that polls the recognize custom form operation until it has completed, has failed, - * or has been cancelled. The completed operation returns a List of {@link RecognizedForm}. - * @throws FormRecognizerException If recognize operation fails and the {@link AnalyzeOperationResult} returned with - * an {@link OperationStatus#FAILED}. - * @throws NullPointerException If {@code formUrl}, {@code modelId} is {@code null}. - */ @ServiceMethod(returns = ReturnType.COLLECTION)

timeline.body: Add a null check for `recognizeOptions` before using it.
timeline.bodyText: Add a null check for recognizeOptions before using it.
timeline.bodyHTML: Add a null check for recognizeOptions before using it.
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.message: sync and async options are different
